boardgame.name: Battle for Germany
boardgame.description: Battle for Germany game is small, it only takes about three to four hours to play for players of normal skill and luck. The game starts in December of 1944 with the Ardennes Offensive (a variant allows the German player to skip this and save his strength). As a two-player game, it is interesting in that each player plays both an Allied army (Western Allies or Soviet Union) AND a German army (Western Front or Eastern Front). This forces each player to play offense and defense. The player playing the Western Allies and Eastern Germans has a very challenging task. The Western Germans have good defensive terrain (the Rhine river and Westwall defenses), while the Eastern Germans have weak units, a long front, very poor defensive terrain and they face a large Soviet and Yugoslav army. The only real advantage enjoyed by the East German player is the lack of victory points to be gained in the East, and the slow Soviet replacement rate. The Western Alllied units are very fast moving, but they don't usually get a chance to exploit this until the very end of the game (at best)._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The map is the same size as most SPI Quadrigames or folio games and has similar graphics. Cities are rated as 1 or 2 victory points, with Berlin worth 10. A line down the middle of Germany cannot be crossed (in the 2-player game), which makes Berlin the only city which can be captured by the Western Allies or the Soviets (ahistorical, but essential to the game's concept). Units are corps for the Germans and Western Allies and corps, armies, or fronts for the Soviet player. Each unit is rated for attack, defense and movement. Combat is decided by an odds-based combat results table and a die roll. Combat results include various combinations of retreat and elimination (there are no step losses, disruption or anything like this). Eliminated units can be replaced, but very slowly and (for some players) with the weakest available unit coming back first._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game includes variants for 3- and 4-player versions where the Germans are played by 1 or 2 players, and a _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;red star/ white star_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; scenario where the Western Allies and Soviets fight it out with some help from the remnants of the German army._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Decision Games boxed version of the game. Game has been just opened, but never played. All components unpunched. Shipping at actual cost dependend on destination, total weight and method of shipment chosen.

For sale here is one brand new, factory sealed, boxed wargame. Battle for Germany is an excellent intro level wargame. Buy it here for the great price of $11.99. USA trackable shipping $4.95 Canada air $6.95 Europe air $9.95. Buy more than one game from me and save on shipping.
Unpunched, with S_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;T #50.

Decision Games edition. Box shows almost no wear. Inside everything there in great condition. All counters unpunched. Shipping at actual cost dependend on destination, total weight and method of shipment chosen.
Played once.

SPI version. The game is complete with rules, map, and all counters. This does not include the magazine that the game originally came in. Counters are punched and in very good shape. There are some markings made on a handful of map hexes indicating forts for one of the alternate scenarios. I will combine on shipping for multiple items so check out my other games for sale.
Counters punched. Components in excellent condition. Comes with S_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;T #50.

Battle for Germany (Decision Games) Condition: mint in shrinkwrap Payment methods: -France: personal check -Europe: bank transfer or Paypal -Rest of the World: Paypal Shipping charges : depending on the number of games you buy from my list (please feel free to ask me for a quotation): - 1 game: you will pay for the full shipping charges. - 2 games: you will only pay for half of the shipping charges. - 3 games or more: shipping charges will be free.
Punched. Includes magazine.
For sale to lesulm1 only, please. (From BGTG Auction #1, http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/33377)

This auction is for one brand new, factory sealed, boxed, wargame. The classic, Battle for Germany. Buy it here for the discounted price of $14.95. Shipping: USA trackable $4.95 Canand $7.95 Everywhere else $13.95. Paypal preferred.

This is the original SPI magazine version of this game. counters unpunched, map and magazine in excellent unused condition magazine cover has some creasing. comes with Strategy _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Tactics issue #50 - May/Jun 1975.

The Battle for Germany, a game that re-enacts the last days of World War Two, 1945. This game is completely mint and unused, counters unpunched. As an added bonus, comes w/a mint copy of Strategy _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Tactics Magazine #50, containing strategy articles about this game.
SPI version. Punched. Complete. Includes mag.

Boxed DG version. The game starts in December of 1944 with the Ardennes Offensive (a variant allows the German player to skip this and save his strength). As a two-player game, it is interesting in that each player plays both an Allied army (Western Allies or Soviet Union) AND a German army (Western Front or Eastern Front). This forces each player to play offense and defense. Condition Notes: Box has ever so slight dishing and minimal shelf wear. Punched. Clipped. Rules have some notations. Shipping Notes: You are welcome to come to Community Game Night (see http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/127654) and pick up your game in person and pay $0 for shipping. Yes, we will gladly combine orders to reduce your per item shipping costs. (To see other items to add to your order see http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geekstore.php3?action=viewuser_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;username=RoamDog). In fact, if you buy enough the shipping costs will be FREE. Please provide a contact phone number--this is ONLY in case there are shipping issues--I am NOT planning to call you. Also, if you would like tracking information, also provide a direct/external (non-BGG) email address. Finally, if at all possible, please provide a business (rather than a residential) address (this will expedite delivery) and let us know that the address you are providing is a business address. Payment Notes: US buyers: USPS money order is preferred. Western Union transfer is also acceptable. However, I can also take a Paypal payment if you have _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 50 positive references on BGG. But the only type of Paypal payment that I can accept is one funded by a Paypal balance or an immediate bank transfer. I cannot take a Paypal payment that is funded via credit card. (Also see the note at the bottom regarding Paypal payments impact on the discounted price). If the receiver elects to not pay extra for insurance (totally up to the receiver) then the receiver agrees to assume responsibility for lost or damaged packages. Non-US buyers: Western Union wire transfer (see www.westernunion.com) is the only acceptable form of payment. Non-US buyers--Please also note that the shipping charge will be outrageously high. Probably high enough that it does not make sense to purchase this item from me. I have no control over this. Insurance will also be REQUIRED (at receiver_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s expense) for shipments to non-US addresses. Receivers outside the US must also agree to assume ALL responsibility for taxes, tariffs, customs duties, etc. If these terms are not acceptable, please do not order from me. **Note that the offered price is the discounted price for a cash (cash, money order, western union) payment. The non-discounted price (i.e. paypal payments) will be 3.0% plus 30 cents higher.

Decision Games (DCG 3003) By mid-December, 1944, the question was how many more lives would be lost before the Third Reich collapsed. In the west, combined armies of France, Britain, and the United States stood on the very border of the German nation. acing them stood the same divisions that four years before had swept all before them. In the east, the massive Soviet forces were about to launch their winter offensive and drive the Wehrmacht to within 30 miles of Berlin. Numerically the German Army was overwhelmed, but some of their shattered divisions were still the best in the world. It was with these crack forces that Germany made one last offensive into the Ardennes. It was a gamble, and it failed. This game is a simulation of a real-world event. It is played on a map that is a simplified terrain reproduction of the actual battlefield. A grid of hexagons printed over the map is used to regulate movement much as the squares on a chess board. The pieces in the game represent the actual military units that took part in the historical conflict.

(RESERVED for a particular buyer until August) Unpunched Kerry Andersen_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s custom die cut counter set (112 count) with a Designer_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Edition box and mounted mapboard (one of the last remaining items from my own original collection from the 70s) and a very excellent rules booklet plus an average condition S_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;T 50. These custom counters retain the same numerical values and NATO symbols, but the colors are changed from the original SPI. The basic Wehrmacht units are slightly altered from gray to a feldgrau (green-gray) While the 6 SS are now black of course and the pair of Fallschirmjager/Luftwaffe korps are a light blue. American units remain drab green but the 6 British counters are now differentiated as a light orange and the 2 Canadian corps are a orange-brown. The 2 Free French are dark blue and the Polish corp is white with red numerals (cool looking given the Polish red/white flag colors). The Soviets are a light brown with red numerals. The 4 Yugoslavian are a darker brown with yellow numerals. The Soviet fielded Polish army is the same light brown as the Soviet counters but has yellow numerals and finally the Bulgarian army is a likewise light brown but with green numerals. I imagine the appearance of the game in play with these counters is quite attractive. Were these punched I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;d learn the rules again in 30 minutes and set it up solo with the Alpenfestung variant and have at it. Speaking of...PLUS Includes comprehensive article collection with the two Battleplan variant scenarios and the Moves_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Alpenfestung_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; variant, RedStar/WhiteStar2, Nazi super weapons and about half a dozen strategy articles covering both versions. I even have these white flak counters from Air War that match the War in Europe flak symbols that would make for a cool Flak Tower/Bunker variant like the pair in Berlin (_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;the Zoo_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;). Maybe give each Allied player one to setup where he wishes. e.g. the Soviet player builds the Zoo in the Ruhr area and the Western Allied player places his in Breslau. +1 to defense or a DRM. this ad has taken long enough. pics when I can. The one to buy to play
